unnormalised: ## Film Festivals: Beyond the Blockbusters, Yaar!
normalised: ## Film Festivals: Beyond the Blockbusters, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema snobs! Ever feel like escaping the usual Friday release frenzy and diving into something…different? Then film festivals are your answer, dost!
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema snobs! Ever feel like escaping the usual Friday release frenzy and diving into something… different? Then film festivals are your answer, dost!

unnormalised: Forget the khichdi of predictable storylines and item numbers (though we secretly love them too, admit it!), film fests are all about discovering hidden gems. Think independent cinema, documentaries that’ll blow your mind, and short films that pack a punch. They’re a total sensory overload in the best way possible.

unnormalised: I remember attending the Kolkata International Film Festival (KIFF) back in 2018. Seriously, the sheer volume of films being screened was insane! From classic Satyajit Ray retrospectives (total nostalgia trip!) to cutting-edge indie films from Iran, there was something for everyone. And the chai and samosas between screenings? Divine!
normalised: I remember attending the Kolkata International Film Festival (K I F F) back in two thousand and eighteen. Seriously, the sheer volume of films being screened was insane! From classic Satyajit Ray retrospectives (total nostalgia trip!) to cutting-edge indie films from Iran, there was something for everyone. And the chai and samosas between screenings? Divine!

unnormalised: It's not just about watching films, either. You get a chance to meet filmmakers, actors (sometimes even big Bollywood names pop in!), and other cinephiles. It's a fantastic community, and who knows, you might even make some friends while debating the merits of that experimental film with the talking squirrel (yes, I saw one!).

unnormalised: But film festivals aren't just for art-house snobs. They're a platform for emerging talent. Places like the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) often showcase their student films at these festivals, giving these future directors a huge boost. Plus, some festivals even have workshops and masterclasses, so you can learn a thing or two from the pros.

unnormalised: So, next time you're looking for something to do, ditch the predictable movie night and check out a film festival near you. You might just discover your new favorite filmmaker or stumble upon a film that changes your perspective on everything. Who knows, maybe you'll even be inspired to make your own! Just remember to book your tickets early, they go faster than pani puri on a hot Delhi day! You could spend Rs. 500 and watch 5 amazing films! That's a bargain. They also happen in other places too - some are 200km away. Just saying.
